title: An excellent new medley, which you may admire at (without offence) for euery line speakes a contrary sences to the tune of, Tarletons medley.
author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?
notes: In two parts: part 2 is bound with part 1 of The batchelors feast (at reel position A5:1[8]).
Verse: "In summertime when solkes [sic] make hay ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
